reviews.title: The Breakfast Was The Best Thing By Far

reviews.text: It was slightly hard to find but good secure parking. The room was reasonable standard – clean but nothing special at all and shower room was not too great. The room we had was the first one guests go past when they walk through corridors, so not a very quiet room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for drivers

reviews.text: The rail way station is a few km away across some busy roads and it’s very small but good access for Amsterdam centre which is what we went for.
reviews.title: Unfriendly Staff
cheap alternative a little out of town
reviews.text: The upside was the food – we had an evening meal and it was a good choice of 3 courses for a very reasonable amount, quick friendly service and generally tasty. Breakfast was delightful and so many lovely things to be had – that was the best thing by far!
The staff was quite helpful but this is not a tourist hotel, so I’d go with information already on what is nearby. Just about average hotel, but certainly would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Not So Close to Amsterdam
Terrible Location!
reviews.text: If you're thinking about staying here while you tour Amsterdam, I'd consider thinking again, particularly if you don't have a car!

There are few hotels in or near Amsterdam offering a 4 bedded room for €130 per night for a family. This had a twin and an adjacent (open door) sleeping room and was clean and comfy but no frills. The breakfast is pricey at €12 per person but compares to other hotels in town which are €20 pp. There are pleanty of cafes in town offering breakfast!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a nice and clean hotel in the suburbs of Amsterdam, very good if you are traveling by car.There is a gas station nearby and free parking.If you go by public transport, the hotel is quite a long hike away from the station.(about 20 minutes) There is no restaurant or supermarket in the vicinity of the hotel except the hotels own restaurant. If you are going to Amsterdam be sure to do it on Queensday, which is the 30.April.

reviews.text: This hotel gave us a place to leave our luggage, shower (sort of), and sleep overnight while we explored the city for 2 days, but not much more than that. The positives of this hotel are that 1) the room had adequate space to accomodate 3 adults and a baby, with a sofa bed and two twin beds that were easily pushed together; 2) it is about a 7 minute walk to the Overamstel metro station (the stop is only 10 minutes to Centraal Station); 3) parking at the hotel is free; and 4) free wireless Internet access if you have your own laptop. The negatives are 1) the broken showerhead that leaked and sprayed water all over the bathroom floor, but not so much in the tub; 2) the dirty towels from the previous guest(s) that were left on the bathroom floor (which we informed the reception desk about on our way out to sightsee and still found when we got back 7 hours later); 3) the disgusting, visibly stained bed covers and carpeting; and 4) the lack of soundproofing which made every passing train from the tracks across the street and car on the nearby highway audible. The gas station, which is literally at the hotel's front doorstep, is convenient, but adds nothing to the hotel's external aesthetic. The security measures (key card access to rooms, elevators, garage, and the front door after dark) were appropriate given the hotel's location, which is outside the main downtown area and somewhat industrial.
